Package problem

Class Field<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • problem.Field<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - describes my type parameter
    public class Field<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic class Field can accept different types of input from users and be used to create a variety of forms.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field​(java.lang.String label,
             java.lang.Boolean required,
             Validator<T> validator)
        Constructor for Class Field. When a Field is first instantiated, value should be null.
        Parameters:
        label - - the String label associated with the form field
        required - - a boolean indicating whether a particular field must be completed before the form can be submitted
        validator - - a Validator that will perform input validation

      • updateValue

        public void updateValue​(T input)
                 throws InvalidInputException
        Update the Field’s value if the input is valid according to the validator. If input is not valid, throw an exception and do not update value.
        Parameters:
        input - - input data, its type will either be String or Boolean
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if the type of input is neither String nor Boolean or invalid according to the validator

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled()
        Return true if the Field has been filled out. Client code can use this method to determine if a form is ready to submit.
        Returns:
        true if the Field has been filled out, otherwise return false
